qa_pairs.question: Who are the members of the ED Code Team?
qa_pairs.answer: ATTENDING: Mid Fast attending (7-3, 3-11, 11-7 shift) OR Pediatrics attending; MIDLEVEL: Acute 2 senior resident OR most senior PA on Acute 2 (Tues PM/Wed AM ONLY); NURSE: PITT RN Captain; ER TECH: PITT ERT 1

qa_pairs.question: What equipment does the Senior Resident/PA secure for ED Code Team response?
qa_pairs.answer: Senior Resident/PA secures ED CODE TEAM BACKPACK, BVM, and portable glidescope

qa_pairs.question: What does the RN secure for ED Code Team response?
qa_pairs.answer: RN secures RED BOX of medications and GLUCOMETER

qa_pairs.question: Where is the EMS stretcher located?
qa_pairs.answer: EMS STRETCHER is located in Zone B alcove

qa_pairs.question: Where does the ED Code Team assemble before proceeding to the incident location?
qa_pairs.answer: ED Code Team proceeds to security desk outside Acute 2 immediately and proceeds as a team to incident location

qa_pairs.question: What smart phrase is used for ED Code Team documentation?
Where is the ED CODE TEAM BACKPACK stored?
qa_pairs.answer: ED CODE TEAM BACKPACK is located in cabinet in Zone B Alcove

qa_pairs.question: What airway equipment is included in the ED Code Team backpack?
qa_pairs.answer: Glidescope MAC 3 blade, Glidescope MAC 4 blade, Direct laryngoscopy MAC 3, LMA size 4.5, ETT sizes 6.5, 7.0, 7.5, Stylet (standard), 10 cc Syringe, Bougie, ETCO2 colorimetric detector, Lubricating jelly
qa_pairs.source_section: ED CODE TEAM BACKPACK EQUIPMENT CHECKLIST

qa_pairs.question: What IV access equipment is in the backpack?
qa_pairs.answer: IV start kit, 18G angiocath, 20G angiocath, 22G angiocath, Saline flushes
qa_pairs.source_section: ACCESS - IV section of equipment checklist

qa_pairs.question: Who leads the ED Code Team debrief?
qa_pairs.answer: Senior resident/PA leads the ED Code Team debrief

qa_pairs.question: What areas does the ED Code Team respond to according to Hospital Policy GPP-215?
qa_pairs.answer: All areas of the first floor lobbies and halls of Guggenheim, Annenberg, Atrium, KCC, Klingenstein Pavilion, and 1184 5th Avenue; All areas of B1 (MC) level including halls and public areas; All areas of B2 (SC) Level; All areas of B3 Level of Atran Building; Annenberg Floors 9 and above, including the Levy Library; Annenberg Floors 1-3, 5; Hess Building (if activated by RESQ team after initial assessment complete)

qa_pairs.question: What should be done if ED Code Team backpack items are used?
qa_pairs.answer: If items used, midlevel disposes of items in used pack, places used pack in used pack shelf for restocking, and replaces with new pack from backup supply in closet to restock backpack

qa_pairs.question: When should the Senior resident/PA check supplies and complete team huddle?
qa_pairs.answer: At the beginning of shift, Senior resident/PA to check all supplies ready and team huddle complete

qa_pairs.question: What documentation is required if the patient is not registered?
qa_pairs.answer: If patient is not registered, no documentation needed

qa_pairs.question: How often does ED Operations team check the backpack supplies?
qa_pairs.answer: ED Operations team rounds daily to assure enough backup packets available and not expired, and checks backpack bimonthly to assure no packets in backpack have expiring items
